original_title: Seylan Bank Posts 20% Surge in 1H 2025 Profit After Tax
original_body_lines: Seylan Bank PLC has reported a robust performance for the first half of 2025, recording a Profit Before Tax (PBT) of LKR 8.4 billion—an increase of 15.18% from LKR 7.3 billion in the same period last year. Profit After Tax (PAT) rose by 20.41% to LKR 5.49 billion, compared to LKR 4.56 billion in 1H 2024.

Despite a 4.45% dip in net interest income—down to LKR 17.76 billion due to falling market rates and loan repricing—the bank’s fee-based income rose 15.43% to LKR 4.3 billion, driven by growth in cards, remittances, and trade services.

Operating income dipped slightly by 0.71% to LKR 23.1 billion, but strong gains from trading activities and other income helped cushion the impact. Total operating expenses increased by 8.37% to LKR 11.26 billion, mainly due to higher personnel costs and inflation-driven service expenses.

A significant reduction in impairment charges—from LKR 2.96 billion to LKR 491 million—helped support the bank’s bottom line. Seylan’s Stage 3 Impaired Loan Ratio improved to 1.76%, while the provision cover stood at a strong 81.82%.
Total assets grew to LKR 812 billion, with loans and deposits reaching LKR 494 billion and LKR 670 billion, respectively. CASA ratio remained stable at 30%.
The bank reported a Return on Equity of 15.29% and Return on Average Assets of 2.15%. Earnings per share rose to LKR 8.63.

Seylan also completed a successful LKR 15 billion debenture issue and received an ‘A+ (lka)’ Fitch rating in January. Its continued CSR commitment was marked by the opening of 19 new “Seylan Pahasara” libraries in 1H 2025.
